Enums/CustomBackground.html#/s:12BJNClie.name: colorNamed(_:)
Enums/CustomBackground.html#/s:12BJNClie.abstract: Constructs a UIColor using the colorNamed parameter from the main asset bundle

Enums/CustomBackground.html#/s:12BJNClie.name: gradient(_:)
Enums/CustomBackground.html#/s:12BJNClie.abstract: Configures a custom gradient using a closure.

Structs/CustomizationParams.html#/s:12BJ.name: containerColorOfAllTiles
Structs/CustomizationParams.html#/s:12BJ.abstract: Background of the entire Remote Video View

Structs/CustomizationParams.html#/s:12BJ.name: videoTileBackgroundColor
Structs/CustomizationParams.html#/s:12BJ.abstract: Background of area behind video views, visible when another participant has a portrait aspect video

Structs/CustomizationParams.html.name: CustomizationParams
Structs/CustomizationParams.html.abstract: The parameters for customizing the background colors of the Remote Video UI.

Enums/CustomBackground.html.name: CustomBackground
Enums/CustomBackground.html.abstract: Enumerates the options for custom backgrounds in the Remote Video UI

Customization.html#/s:12BJNClientSDK22Co.name: ConfigureGradientLayer
Customization.html#/s:12BJNClientSDK22Co.abstract: A custom closure that can be used to set the parameters of the CAGradientLayer.

Classes/BJNMutableObservable.html#/s:12B.name: value
Classes/BJNMutableObservable.html#/s:12B.abstract: Represents the value of this BJNMutableObservable. Value is a mutable property and can be updated.

Classes/BJNObservable.html#/s:12BJNClien.name: publisher
Classes/BJNObservable.html#/s:12BJNClien.abstract: A Combine publisher that publishes a new value every time the value changes.

Classes/BJNObservable.html#/s:12BJNClien.name: value
Classes/BJNObservable.html#/s:12BJNClien.abstract: Represents the value of this BJNObservable. Read only.

Classes/BJNObservable.html#/s:12BJNClien.name: onChange(handler:)
Classes/BJNObservable.html#/s:12BJNClien.abstract: Register a callback to be executed when the value of this BJNObservable changes.

Classes/BJNObservable.html#/s:12BJNClien.name: unsubscribeFromChanges(_:)
Classes/BJNObservable.html#/s:12BJNClien.abstract: Remove a previously subscribed callback handler. That handler will no longer be executed when the value of the BJNObservable changes.

Classes/BJNObservable.html.name: BJNObservable
Classes/BJNObservable.html.abstract: BJNObservable is a generic type that generates a callback when its value is changed.

Classes/BJNMutableObservable.html.name: BJNMutableObservable
Classes/BJNMutableObservable.html.abstract: BJNMutableObservable is a BJNObservable that allows its value to be changed.

Protocols/ClosedCaptioningServiceProtoco.name: startClosedCaptioning()
Protocols/ClosedCaptioningServiceProtoco.abstract: Starts the closed captioning service, text can then be observed through the cclosedCaptionText property.

Protocols/ClosedCaptioningServiceProtoco.name: isClosedCaptioningOn
Protocols/ClosedCaptioningServiceProtoco.abstract: True if closed captioning is on, will be nil out of meeting.

Protocols/ClosedCaptioningServiceProtoco.name: isClosedCaptioningAvailable
Protocols/ClosedCaptioningServiceProtoco.abstract: True if closed captioning feature is enabled for this meeting.

Protocols/ClosedCaptioningServiceProtoco.name: closedCaptionText
Protocols/ClosedCaptioningServiceProtoco.abstract: The closed caption text string, will be updated frequently as the predicted string changes.

Protocols/ClosedCaptioningServiceProtoco.name: ClosedCaptioningServiceProtocol
Protocols/ClosedCaptioningServiceProtoco.abstract: Closed Captioning is the ability to provide text for the words spoken in meetings.

Enums/RecordingError.html#/s:12BJNClient.name: recordingSpaceNotAvailable
Enums/RecordingError.html#/s:12BJNClient.abstract: The meeting owner has no space available to record

Enums/RecordingError.html#/s:12BJNClient.name: recordingFeatureNotAvailable
Enums/RecordingError.html#/s:12BJNClient.abstract: The recording feature is not available for this meeting owner

Enums/RecordingError.html#/s:12BJNClient.name: notInMeeting
Enums/RecordingError.html#/s:12BJNClient.abstract: Using the start recording API outside of an active meeting

Enums/RecordingError.html#/s:12BJNClient.name: unknown
Enums/RecordingError.html#/s:12BJNClient.abstract: An unknown error is returned by the API

Enums/RecordingSuccess.html#/s:12BJNClie.name: recordingSpaceLimited
Enums/RecordingSuccess.html#/s:12BJNClie.abstract: The meeting owner has used almost all of their available recording minutes

Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.name: isModeratorControlsAvailable
Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.abstract: True if we are moderator and the controls are available, false if they are not. Nil out of a meeting.

Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.name: isRecordingFeatureAvailable
Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.abstract: Observable that provides about recording feature is available for the meeting.

Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.name: setAudioMutedForAllParticipants(muted:)
Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.abstract: Set audio Muted/Umuted state for all participants in current meeting

Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.name: setVideoMutedForAllParticipants(muted:)
Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.abstract: Set video Muted/Umuted state for all participants in current meeting

Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.name: setVideoMutedForParticipant(muted:participant:)
Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.abstract: Set video Muted/Umuted for a participant in current meeting

Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.name: setAudioMutedForParticipant(muted:participant:)
Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.abstract: Set audio Muted/Umuted for a participant in current meeting

Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.name: removeParticipant(participant:)
Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.abstract: Remove a participant out of the current meeting

Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.name: endMeetingForAllParticipants(timeInSeconds:)
Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.abstract: End current meeting for all participant in timeInSeconds seconds. This will also leave the meeting for the moderator calling this function.

Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.name: ModeratorControlsServiceProtocol
Protocols/ModeratorControlsServiceProtoc.abstract: ModeratorControlsService can be used to control moderator specific actions in the meeting.

Enums/RecordingError.html.name: RecordingError
Enums/RecordingError.html.abstract: Represents an error from the BlueJeans API when recording is started.

Protocols/ParticipantsServiceProtocol.ht.name: participants
Protocols/ParticipantsServiceProtocol.ht.abstract: An observable immutable list of participants in the meeting, will fire a change event when any one of the properties on these participants changes. Although updates may be batched.

Protocols/ParticipantsServiceProtocol.ht.name: selfParticipant
Protocols/ParticipantsServiceProtocol.ht.abstract: An observable for the self participant. The self participant is also present in the participants list.

Protocols/ParticipantsServiceProtocol.ht.name: activeSpeaker
Protocols/ParticipantsServiceProtocol.ht.abstract: The active, or dominant speaker in the conversation. Can be nil if no-one is talking.

Protocols/ParticipantsServiceProtocol.ht.name: ParticipantsServiceProtocol
Protocols/ParticipantsServiceProtocol.ht.abstract: An in meeting service to keep track of the participants in the meeting.

Structs/WaitingRoomParticipant.html#/s:1.name: id
Structs/WaitingRoomParticipant.html#/s:1.abstract: A unique identifier for the participant while in the waiting room.

Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.name: admitAll()
Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.abstract: Admit all of the participants in the waiting room into the meeting.

Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.name: denyAll()
Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.abstract: Deny all of the participants in the waiting room, this will remove them from the waiting room.

Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.name: deny(participant:)
Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.abstract: Deny a single participant from the waiting room.

Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.name: demote(participant:)
Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.abstract: Demote a participant from the meeting back into the waiting room.

Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.name: isWaitingRoomCapable
Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.abstract: True if this meeting supports waiting room.

Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.name: isWaitingRoomEnabled
Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.abstract: If true, the waiting room is enabled and anyone who joins with a participant passcode will be placed into the waiting room until the are admitted or denied by a moderator.

Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.name: setWaitingRoomEnabled(_:)
Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.abstract: Can be used to set the enablement of waiting room.

Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.name: waitingRoomParticipants
Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.abstract: An array of participants in the waiting room, will fire a change event when a participant joins or leaves the waiting room.

Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.name: ModeratorWaitingRoomServiceProtocol
Protocols/ModeratorWaitingRoomServicePro.abstract: The service used to moderate the waiting room, for example to deny a participant from joining the meeting, admit a participant into the meeting, or demote a participant back into the waiting room from the meeting.

Protocols/ContentShareServiceProtocol.ht.name: contentShareAvailability
Protocols/ContentShareServiceProtocol.ht.abstract: Whether content share is available, if the value is available or hijackingAvailable then we can show the RPSystemBroadcastPickerView in the UI to allow Content Share to be initiated.

Protocols/ContentShareServiceProtocol.ht.name: contentShareStopReason
Protocols/ContentShareServiceProtocol.ht.abstract: We can watch this value to provide information to the user about why content sharing has stopped. For example because there sharing was hijacked or taken over by another user.

Protocols/ContentShareServiceProtocol.ht.name: confirmContentShare()
Protocols/ContentShareServiceProtocol.ht.abstract: Can be used to confirm that we wish to take over content sharing when requireConfirmationBeforeHijacking is set to true.

Protocols/ContentShareServiceProtocol.ht.name: stopContentShare()
Protocols/ContentShareServiceProtocol.ht.abstract: Stops the content share. This will cause the extension to provide an alert, the message can be set by providing a ContentShareMessageProvideron initialising the SDK.

Protocols/ContentShareServiceProtocol.ht.name: ContentShareServiceProtocol
Protocols/ContentShareServiceProtocol.ht.abstract: The ContentShareService can be used to share the screen from a device.

Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.name: chatHistoryForParticipant(_:)
Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Provides an observable value of an array of chat messages for a given participant in the meeting.

Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.name: unreadCountForParticipant(_:)
Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Provides the unread message count per participant for private chat It is the responsibility of client app to clear this count once consumed by calling clearUnreadMessagesCountByParticipant

Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.name: clearUnreadMessagesCountByParticipant(_:)
Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Clears the unread message count of specified BJNParticipant, the consumer application must call it when the user has viewed the unread chat messages of the participant to get the correct unread message count for messages.

Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.name: unreadMessagesCount
Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Show the total current unread message count of private messages It is the responsibility of client app to clear this count once consumed by calling clearUnreadMessagesCount

Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.name: clearUnreadMessagesCount()
Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Clears the unread message count of all eligible participants Consumer application must call it when the user had viewed the unread chat messages to get the correct unread message count for future

Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.name: eligibleParticipants
Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Provides the list of BJNParticipants eligible for private chat All participants may not be eligible for private chat as the client on which they join from, may not have the feature available

Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.name: participantsWithChats
Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Provides a list of the BJNParticipants who have participated in private chat with you (sending or receiving) during this meeting.

Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.name: newMessage
Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Provides an observable value for new private chat messages.

Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.name: isPrivateChatAvailable
Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Is true when the private chat is available.

Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.name: sendMessage(message:to:)
Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Sends a private chat message to an eligible participant

Protocols/PublicChatServiceProtocol.html.name: isChatAvailable
Protocols/PublicChatServiceProtocol.html.abstract: Is true when the chat service is active, enabled for the meeting, and the network conditions allow chat to be sent and received.

Protocols/PublicChatServiceProtocol.html.name: chatHistory
Protocols/PublicChatServiceProtocol.html.abstract: The chat history, newly joined users will only see the last 10 messages. May be cleared by a remote moderator endpoint.

Protocols/PublicChatServiceProtocol.html.name: unreadMessagesCount
Protocols/PublicChatServiceProtocol.html.abstract: The number of unread messages. Call clearUnreadMessageCount() to reset this.

Protocols/PublicChatServiceProtocol.html.name: clearUnreadMessagesCount()
Protocols/PublicChatServiceProtocol.html.abstract: Clears the unread message count of all eligible participants Consumer application must call it when the user had viewed the unread chat messages to get the correct unread message count for future

Protocols/PublicChatServiceProtocol.html.name: sendMessage(message:)
Protocols/PublicChatServiceProtocol.html.abstract: Sends a message in chat to all the participants

Protocols/PublicChatServiceProtocol.html.name: PublicChatServiceProtocol
Protocols/PublicChatServiceProtocol.html.abstract: Public Chat Service can be used to send and receive chat messages on a public channel within the meeting.

Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.name: PrivateChatServiceProtocol
Protocols/PrivateChatServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Private Chat Service can be used to send and receive chat messages privately to other participants in the meeting.

Enums/LoggingMode.html#/c:@M@BJNClientSD.name: verbose
Enums/LoggingMode.html#/c:@M@BJNClientSD.abstract: Error, warning, info, debug and verbose logs

Protocols/LoggingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: uploadLogs(comments:username:removeAfterUpload:onCompletion:)
Protocols/LoggingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Uploads the last 7 days of BlueJeans logs to the BlueJeans Cloud. Can be used to to help us diagnose issues.

Protocols/LoggingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: uploadLogs(comments:username:onCompletion:)
Protocols/LoggingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Uploads the last 7 days of BlueJeans logs to the BlueJeans Cloud. Can be used to to help us diagnose issues.

Protocols/LoggingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: loggingMode
Protocols/LoggingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Represents the extent of logging detail provided by the SDK in order to diagnose operations.

Protocols/LoggingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: setLoggingMode(to:)
Protocols/LoggingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Sets the logging mode, changes can be observed with the loggingMode property

Protocols/LoggingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: enableAudioCaptureDump(_:)
Protocols/LoggingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Enables Audio dump for debug purposes while in a meeting

Protocols/LoggingServiceProtocol.html.name: LoggingServiceProtocol
Protocols/LoggingServiceProtocol.html.abstract: The Logging Service can be used to set the log levels of the BlueJeansSDK, and to upload logs to BlueJeans for trouble shooting.

Enums/LoggingMode.html.name: LoggingMode
Enums/LoggingMode.html.abstract: Represents extent of logging of SDK activity appropriate to diagnose operations.

Protocols/AudioDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: createAudioDeviceSelectionPresenterView()
Protocols/AudioDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Engages the OS resident UI and method for Audio device selection.

Protocols/AudioDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: audioSessionActive
Protocols/AudioDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Use this observable to know when the audio session for the SDK is active.

Protocols/AudioDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: AudioDeviceServiceProtocol
Protocols/AudioDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: The Audio Device Service can be used to access the native audio device selection picker on iOS.

Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: cameraDevice
Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Represents the current local camera device selected. Use selectCameraDevice(:) for selecting a local camera device.

Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: selectCameraDevice(_:)
Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Selects which local camera device to use.

Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: getSelfViewInstance()
Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Returns a new UIView instance that renders the video coming from the device’s internal camera(s).

Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: getSelfView()
Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Returns the UIView instance that renders video coming from the device’s internal camera(s). The video within this UIView will maintain the correct aspect ratio as resolution or orientation changes with the video center-aligned and fit within the bounds of the view.

Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: getContentShareInstance()
Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Returns a new UIView instance that renders the shared collaboration view coming from the BlueJeans cloud.

Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: getContentShareView()
Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Returns the UIView instance that renders the shared content view coming from the BlueJeans cloud. The content within this UIView will maintain the correct aspect ratio as resolution or orientation changes with the content center-aligned and fit within the bounds of the view.

Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: getRemoteVideoController()
Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: Returns a new UIViewController instance that displays the videos coming from the BlueJeans cloud. Respects the VideoLayout which can be observed and changed with the meetingService.videoLayout property.

Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: enableSelfVideoPreview
Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: A boolean variable, if true, indicates that the SDK will turn on the local camera to allow the user to see themselves before connecting into a video meeting.

Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: captureIsActive
Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: A property which identifies if video is being captured by the SDK, either for meeting video or for enableSelfVideoPreview property. True if the camera capture is on.

Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: selfViewSize
Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: A property which captures the resolution of the self view video stream - in particular this should be observed to track changes in aspect ratio of the self view due to rotation of the device between landscape and portrait.

Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: contentShareSize
Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: A property which captures the resolution of the received content share video stream - use this to determine the correct aspect ratio for the content share view.

Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.name: VideoDeviceServiceProtocol
Protocols/VideoDeviceServiceProtocol.htm.abstract: The Video Device Service handles video related API’s, such as selecting a camera device, or getting the Remote/Self/Content video streams.

Enums/CameraDevice.html.name: CameraDevice
Enums/CameraDevice.html.abstract: Name of the desired camera device to use.

Protocols/PermissionServiceProtocol.html.name: hasRequiredPermissions
Protocols/PermissionServiceProtocol.html.abstract: An observable boolean, specifies whether the user has granted the required permissions to join a meeting.

Protocols/PermissionServiceProtocol.html.name: requiredPermissions
Protocols/PermissionServiceProtocol.html.abstract: An array of the Permission which are required to have an PermissionStatus of .authorized before we can join a meeting

Protocols/PermissionServiceProtocol.html.name: currentPermissions
Protocols/PermissionServiceProtocol.html.abstract: The current state of permissions in the SDK.

Protocols/PermissionServiceProtocol.html.name: requestPermission(for:onCompletion:)
Protocols/PermissionServiceProtocol.html.abstract: Request permissions for the Permission required to join the meeting.

Protocols/PermissionServiceProtocol.html.name: PermissionServiceProtocol
Protocols/PermissionServiceProtocol.html.abstract: The permission service can be used to check and request and set the required permissions from the user to join a meeting.

Enums/WaitingRoomEvent.html#/s:12BJNClie.name: approved
Enums/WaitingRoomEvent.html#/s:12BJNClie.abstract: The moderator has approved entry into the waiting room, the user will connect to the meeting automatically.

Enums/WaitingRoomEvent.html#/s:12BJNClie.name: denied
Enums/WaitingRoomEvent.html#/s:12BJNClie.abstract: The moderator has denied entry into the meeting, this will remove the user from the waiting room and return them to the idle meetingState.

Enums/WaitingRoomEvent.html#/s:12BJNClie.name: demoted
Enums/WaitingRoomEvent.html#/s:12BJNClie.abstract: The participant has been sent back to the waiting room from the meeting.

Enums/WaitingRoomEvent.html#/s:12BJNClie.name: meetingEnded
Enums/WaitingRoomEvent.html#/s:12BJNClie.abstract: The meeting was ended while the participant was in the waiting room.

Structs/MeetingInformation.html#/s:12BJN.name: meetingTitle
Structs/MeetingInformation.html#/s:12BJN.abstract: Title of the meeting or waiting room

Structs/MeetingInformation.html#/s:12BJN.name: meetingID
Structs/MeetingInformation.html#/s:12BJN.abstract: Meeting ID of the meeting or waiting room

Structs/MeetingInformation.html#/s:12BJN.name: participantPasscode
Structs/MeetingInformation.html#/s:12BJN.abstract: The participant passcode if one is set (not available in the waiting room)

Structs/MeetingInformation.html#/s:12BJN.name: meetingHost
Structs/MeetingInformation.html#/s:12BJN.abstract: Name of the meeting host (not available in the waiting room)

Structs/MeetingInformation.html#/s:12BJN.name: meetingUri
Structs/MeetingInformation.html#/s:12BJN.abstract: Uri for the live meeting (not available in the waiting room)

Enums/VideoLayout.html#/c:@M@BJNClientSD.name: speaker
Enums/VideoLayout.html#/c:@M@BJNClientSD.abstract: Only the most recent speaker is shown, taking up the whole video stream.

Enums/VideoLayout.html#/c:@M@BJNClientSD.name: people
Enums/VideoLayout.html#/c:@M@BJNClientSD.abstract: The most recent speaker is shown as a larger video. A filmstrip of the next (up to) 5 most recent speakers is shown at the bottom.

Enums/VideoLayout.html#/c:@M@BJNClientSD.name: gallery
Enums/VideoLayout.html#/c:@M@BJNClientSD.abstract: Up to the 9 most recent speakers are shown, arranged in a grid layout of equal sizes.

Enums/MeetingState.html#/s:12BJNClientSD.name: idle
Enums/MeetingState.html#/s:12BJNClientSD.abstract: Not in a meeting, or disconnected/dropped from the meeting

Enums/MeetingState.html#/s:12BJNClientSD.name: validating
Enums/MeetingState.html#/s:12BJNClientSD.abstract: Intitial request to join API in progress

Enums/MeetingState.html#/s:12BJNClientSD.name: waitingRoom
Enums/MeetingState.html#/s:12BJNClientSD.abstract: The client is in the waiting room, waiting for the moderator to either accept or deny our entry to the meeting.

Enums/MeetingState.html#/s:12BJNClientSD.name: connecting
Enums/MeetingState.html#/s:12BJNClientSD.abstract: Join API successful and now connecting video and audio streams, most in meeting logic available now but values may change

Enums/MeetingState.html#/s:12BJNClientSD.name: reconnecting
Enums/MeetingState.html#/s:12BJNClientSD.abstract: Call connection has dropped and BlueJeans is attempting to reconnect to the meeting.

Enums/MeetingState.html#/s:12BJNClientSD.name: connected
Enums/MeetingState.html#/s:12BJNClientSD.abstract: Fully connected to the call media although updates to roster and chat might be delayed

Enums/VideoStateInactiveReason.html#/s:1.name: onlyParticipant
Enums/VideoStateInactiveReason.html#/s:1.abstract: Video is inactive since only one participant is present in meeting

Enums/VideoStateInactiveReason.html#/s:1.name: noOneHasVideo
Enums/VideoStateInactiveReason.html#/s:1.abstract: Video is inactive since no one has shared any video

Enums/VideoStateInactiveReason.html#/s:1.name: needsModerator
Enums/VideoStateInactiveReason.html#/s:1.abstract: Video is inactive since there are no moderator present in a moderator required meeting

Enums/VideoStateInactiveReason.html#/s:1.name: disconnected
Enums/VideoStateInactiveReason.html#/s:1.abstract: Video is inactive since meeting is disconnected

Enums/VideoStateInactiveReason.html#/s:1.name: connecting
Enums/VideoStateInactiveReason.html#/s:1.abstract: We haven’t fully connected to the meeting or received information about the participants, so video is still inactive.

Enums/VideoState.html#/s:12BJNClientSDK1.name: inactive(_:)
Enums/VideoState.html#/s:12BJNClientSDK1.abstract: Video is not active, has an associated VideoStateInactiveReason value.

Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.name: networkError
Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.abstract: Internet is not connected or bandwidth is too low to make a network call

Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.name: loginRequired
Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.abstract: When not logged in or when forcing moderator login is enabled for meeting, login is not supported by the SDK directly.

Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.name: meetingLocked
Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.abstract: Moderator has locked the meeting no more participants are allowed to join

Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.name: tryAgainLater
Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.abstract: Server has detected too many requests or request is deemed unsafe

Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.name: fraudDetected
Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.abstract: Request from unauthorized account or joining secured meeting without access or passcode expired

Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.name: internalError
Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.abstract: Unable to process the request due to an internal error

Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.name: restrictedMeeting
Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.abstract: The meeting is restricted. Go to http://bluejeans.com/{meetingId} and enter email. If allowed to join, user will receive passcode on email address provided.

Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.name: leftOrDeniedFromWaitingRoom
Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.abstract: Either the user left the waiting room, or was denied.

Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.name: cancelled
Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html#/s:12BJNCli.abstract: The join call was cancelled, for example by calling .leave() while joining.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: contentShareService
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Service responsible for screen sharing methods and properties.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: publicChatService
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Public Chat Service can be used to send and receive chat messages on a public channel within the meeting.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: privateChatService
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Private Chat Service can be used to send and receive chat messages privately to other participants in the meeting.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: moderatorControlsService
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Moderator Controls Service is used for moderator specific actions, such as muting another participant or starting and stopping recording. The actions are only available when the meeting is joined with a moderator passcode.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: closedCaptioningService
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Closed Captioning is the ability to provide text for the words spoken in meetings.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: moderatorWaitingRoomService
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Allows the moderator of a waiting room enabled meeting to control the waiting room. For example, observe the participants in the waiting room, to admit or deny one or all of them and to toggle the enablement of the waiting room.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: participantsService
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Service used to keep track of the participants in the meeting.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: join(meetingID:passcode:displayName:onCompletion:)
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: The join function connects the client into a BlueJeans meeting room in the cloud. This call will not schedule a meeting, so the meeting must have already been scheduled/exist. When joining the (existing) meeting the client will either see participants, or the screen shown to the first participant.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: leave()
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: The leave function disconnects this client session from the BlueJeans meeting room in the cloud.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: videoLayout
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Represents how each of the remote participant’s video is composited into the single video stream received by the client.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: setVideoLayout(to:)
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Sets the videoLayout property.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: receivingScreenShare
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: A boolean variable, if true, represents that the BlueJeans meeting has a collaborative screen sharing session running.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: videoState
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Represents the current connection-state of the client application’s video media, and the meeting in the BlueJeans meeting.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: meetingState
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: A single value that represents the state of a meeting. Once the MeetingState moves from Validating to Connecting then most in meeting services will become available.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: audioMuted
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Represents the current state of microphone audio. The variable may be updated(set) by the client application, or by messages from the backend infrastructure.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: audioMuteState
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Represents the current state of microphone audio. The variable may be updated(set) by the client application, or by messages from the backend infrastructure.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: videoMuted
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Represents the current state of video display. The variable may be updated(set) by the client application, or by messages from the backend infrastructure.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: videoMuteState
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Represents the current state of video display. The variable may be updated(set) by the client application, or by messages from the backend infrastructure.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: setAudioMuted(to:)
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Sets the mute state of audio, in and out of meeting.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: setVideoMuted(to:)
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Sets the mute state of video, in and out of meeting.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: maxVideoBandwidth
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Specifies the max video bandwith to be used by BJNVideo. Should be set before joining a meeting.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: recordingState
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Is true when the meeting is being recorded to the BlueJeans Cloud. It is important to provide a strong audio and visual cue that this is happening to ensure the user is aware they are being recorded for privacy reasons.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: playSoundFile(path:)
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Use this function to play any sounds during a meeting. For example playing a sound to notify the user that recording has started. It is important to use this function and not the inbuilt iOS functions otherwise the BlueJeans audio session might not be handled correctly.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: meetingInformation
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Provides information about the current meeting or waiting room.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: setContentMuted(_:)
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Updates the content mute state when in meeting. This can be used to stop the remote content stream in situations it is not needed.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: setRemoteVideoMuted(_:)
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Updates the remote video mute state when in meeting. This can mute the remote video stream received from other participants, for example to be used in a bandwith saving mode.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: setRemoteAudioMuted(_:)
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Updates the remote audio mute state when in meeting. This can mute the remote audio stream received from other participants, for example to be used in a content receive only mode. This will immediately mute the speaker locally, then request that the cloud service stop sending or receiving audio to the client.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: contentMuted
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: True when the content stream is muted.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: remoteVideoMuted
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: True when the remote video streams are muted.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: remoteAudioMuted
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: True when the remote audio streams are muted.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.name: waitingRoomEvent
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html#/s.abstract: Subscribe to this subject to receive events when the participant is accepted or denied from the waiting room, or demoted to it. Can be used to display notifications.

Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html.name: MeetingServiceProtocol
Protocols/MeetingServiceProtocol.html.abstract: This service encapsulates meeting specific actions within the SDK, it also includes nested services for API’s that are only available in meeting. For example, public and private chat, and content share.

Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html.name: MeetingJoinResult
Enums/MeetingJoinResult.html.abstract: A result given after joining, or failing to join a meeting.

Enums/VideoState.html.name: VideoState
Enums/VideoState.html.abstract: Represents the current state of connection between the client application’s video media, and the connection to a BlueJeans meeting.

Enums/VideoLayout.html.name: VideoLayout
Enums/VideoLayout.html.abstract: Represents how each of the remote participant’s videos are composited into the single video stream received by the client.

Structs/MeetingInformation.html.name: MeetingInformation
Structs/MeetingInformation.html.abstract: Provides information about the meeting or waiting room, for example the meeting ID or title.

Enums/WaitingRoomEvent.html.name: WaitingRoomEvent
Enums/WaitingRoomEvent.html.abstract: Waiting room event This can used to provide information to the user about meeting state changes related to the waiting room.

Structs/MuteState.html.name: MuteState
Structs/MuteState.html.abstract: Holds information about the mute status, and the reason for the mute.

Structs/BlueJeansSDKInitParams.html#/s:1.name: contentShareParameters
Structs/BlueJeansSDKInitParams.html#/s:1.abstract: Configures the behaviour when content is shared from the SDK. Can be set to nil if content/screen sharing is not implemented.

Structs/BlueJeansSDKInitParams.html#/s:1.name: is5x5GalleryLayoutEnabled
Structs/BlueJeansSDKInitParams.html#/s:1.abstract: If set to true, then in .gallery videoLayout, there will be a maximum of 5x5 (landscape) or 8x3 (portrait) videos in a grid. Otherwise there will be a maximum of 3x3 (landscape) or 4x2 (portrait) videos. Reccomended to be set to true only on newer devices, and those with larger screens.

Structs/BlueJeansSDKInitParams.html#/s:1.name: playIVRs
Structs/BlueJeansSDKInitParams.html#/s:1.abstract: If set to true, then when the meeting is recorded, an audio message indicating that recording is in progress will be played to the user. “Recording has started” “Recording has stopped” or “Recording is on”.

Classes/BlueJeansSDK.html.name: BlueJeansSDK
Classes/BlueJeansSDK.html.abstract: The BlueJeans iOS Video Software Development Kit (SDK) enables embedding BlueJeans Video and Audio capabilities into iOS apps. BlueJeansSDK is a single namespace that encapsulates all the APIs related to establishing a BlueJeans Video and Audio connection.

Structs/BlueJeansSDKInitParams.html.name: BlueJeansSDKInitParams
Structs/BlueJeansSDKInitParams.html.abstract: To be used as a parameter of the BlueJeansSDK.initialize method.
